commit_message:
Centralize exception management for Neutron

A common pattern we use is to catch OpenStack clients exceptions and
re-raise an OpenStackCloud* exceptions.
Moreover, we need to distinguish NeutronClientException with status
code 404 from other Neutron exceptions in order to handle Rax broken
catalog (i.e. falling-through and using Nova API).

This patch centralises all that.

Change-Id: Ia14083bee7988e90a9e5ce04305a8ead4511b3d3

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-19 08:16:26.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/requirements.txt'], 'message': "Pin keystonemiddleware max version

To resolve requirements conflicts in most painless way before 6.1 GA
let's ping keystonemiddleware to max version 2.0.0 and in 7.0 we
can remove upper bounds as well update packages in our mirros.

Change-Id: I98055060480a2ef80b9d56a211812e98e27fa2e1
Closes-Bug: #1466733
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Pin keystonemiddleware max version

To resolve requirements conflicts in most painless way before 6.1 GA
let's ping keystonemiddleware to max version 2.0.0 and in 7.0 we
can remove upper bounds as well update packages in our mirros.

Change-Id: I98055060480a2ef80b9d56a211812e98e27fa2e1
Closes-Bug: #1466733

commit_message:
Create keystone user in start.sh if it doesn't exist

This is required for the source install method (for packages the
user/group is added as part of install)

Change-Id: I9b2e8d3757587276c21967ee67d45277616d433f

subject: Symlink all non Dockerfile resources in images
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1390, 'name': 'Paul Bourke', 'email': 'pauldbourke@proton.me', 'username': 'pauldbourke'}, {'_account_id': 2834, 'name': 'Steven Dake', 'email': 'steven.dake@gmail.com', 'username': 'sdake'}, {'_account_id': 3098, 'name': 'Jeff Peeler', 'email': 'jpeeler@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpeeler-z'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin Andr√©', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 14027, 'name': 'Michal Rostecki', 'email': 'mrostecki@suse.de', 'username': 'mrostecki'}, {'_account_id': 14119, 'name': 'Sam Yaple', 'email': 'sam+git@yaple.net', 'username': 'SamYaple'}, {'_account_id': 16520, 'name': 'Borne Mace', 'email': 'borne.mace@oracle.com', 'username': 'bmace'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-10 11:07:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Symlink all non Dockerfile resources in images

The only files in the docker image directories that differ majorly
between distros are the Dockerfiles (e.g. different package manager
mechanisms, different repo sources, etc).

The supporting files such as the start.sh/check.sh and config files
should largely stay the same between base images.

This change moves these files up into a "base" directory, and symlinks
them in the same way that the build script is managed. This means when
adding a new base distro only new Dockerfiles need to be created. Also,
if a distro does happen to require a vastly different start.sh script
for example, one can choose to simply not symlink to the base and
instead drop in a custom one.

Implements: blueprint refactor-base-image-layout

Change-Id: Ic4db69d31ff54a1fb95af4853a2e5ae490064284

commit_message:
Symlink all non Dockerfile resources in images

The only files in the docker image directories that differ majorly between
distros are the Dockerfiles (e.g. different package manager mechanisms,
different repo sources, etc).

The supporting files such as the start.sh/check.sh and config files should
largely stay the same between base images.

This change moves these files up into a "common" directory, and symlinks them
in the same way that the build script is managed. This means when adding a new
base distro only new Dockerfiles need to be created. Also, if a distro does
happen to require a vastly different start.sh script for example, one can
choose to simply not symlink to the common and instead drop in a custom one.

Implements: blueprint refactor-base-image-layout

Change-Id: Ic4db69d31ff54a1fb95af4853a2e5ae490064284

commit_message:
[Heat] Add rally template with Heat Resource Group

The patch adds a rally template for
Heat.create_and_delete_stack scenario that allows
to test performance of creation and deletion of Heat
Resource Groups.
The template allows to create a stack that contain
N instances and N volumes attached, where N - is
num_instances parameter in rally template.

Change-Id: If5c7c787c670b464eb3386635bcb1bfc5a218075

commit_message:
Neutron l3, dhcp, ovs, metadata agents now are independed.

Removing co-location between agents prevent us from unrequired
start/stop operations for agents.

Since Juno agents dependency no more need, end even harmful.

Change-Id: I35358dae14ae73e720b705c2d7a46825a1be8fca
Closes-bug: #1459528

subject: Generate consistent length passwords in AIO
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-16 14:23:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Generate consistent length passwords in AIO

The bootstrap-aio.sh script generates a password by reading a set number
of characters from urandom then removing those that aren't alphanumeric.
The problem with this is that its possible for 0 characters to remain.

This patch changes the order so that tr (translate) reads urandom
directly and removes non alphanumeric characters then that output is
truncated to the required length. This ensures the generated password is
always the desired length.

Change-Id: I03984ab891f88fe4b064f7f7fcb71edf48096493
Closes-Bug: #1465684
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-16 22:25:41.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh'], 'message': "Generate consistent length passwords in AIO

The bootstrap-aio.sh script generates a password by reading a set number
of characters from urandom then removing those that aren't alphanumeric.
The problem with this is that its possible for 0 characters to remain.

This patch changes the order so that tr (translate) reads urandom
directly and removes non alphanumeric characters then that output is
truncated to the required length. This ensures the generated password is

Change-Id: I03984ab891f88fe4b064f7f7fcb71edf48096493
Closes-Bug: #1465684
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Generate consistent length passwords in AIO

The bootstrap-aio.sh script generates a password by reading a set number
of characters from urandom then removing those that aren't alphanumeric.
The problem with this is that its possible for 0 characters to remain.

This patch changes the order so that tr (translate) reads urandom
directly and removes non alphanumeric characters then that output is
truncated to the required length. This ensures the generated password is
always the desired length.

Change-Id: I03984ab891f88fe4b064f7f7fcb71edf48096493
Closes-Bug: #1465684

commit_message:
Fix function name reference in cinder.service.spec.js

This patch fixes a typo when referencing tested function names
in the it block that iterates over the tests array, so the
correct names are displayed in Jasmine spec runner.

Change-Id: I2685272063b1a599d0c4356e234a779c63d099e1

commit_message:
Ensure /etc/nova exists before creating secret.xml

Without declaring a dependency, secret.xml can be
created before the folder is created through
the installation of the nova packages.

Closes-bug: #1458628
Change-Id: I0b9aec13866e4e334bcaf967192b2bc310ae20fb

commit_message:
NexentaStor SA: get the right LUN from mapping

In case there are several mappings for a ZVol hardcoded '0'
will result in failure of volume attachement by Nova.

Change-Id: I3f0e1ce86864eb3c496da02e4c4bdb635bbeb799
Closes-Bug: 1430961

commit_message:
Cleanup session creation

When using the session object we want to pass through unknown kwargs to
the adapter so that keystoneclient can add new parameters as required.

This requires fixing the old options so that we can restrict what is
passed and showing a warning when there are values that are being
ignored.

Change-Id: Ia795dfc8e16c60a08df1636816daefe2ebbd0b03

commit_message:
Introduce Guru Meditation Reports into Cinder

This commit integrates functionality from the
`openstack.common.report` module into Cinder.
This enables Cinder services to receive SIGUSR1
and print a Guru Meditation Report to stderr.
The required modules were added to
'openstack-common.conf' as well.

It is essentially a copy from implementation of
nova side.

Change-Id: I5bbdc0f97db9b0ebd7b48e50ab7869e2ca33aead
Implements: blueprint guru-meditation-report

commit_message:
Update of `support-modify-volume-image-metadata.rst`

Since snapshot is immutable, we shouldn't provide the capability
to update image metadata referenced with snapshot.
And part of this Spec is not well formatted, we should update it
to make it easier to read after the rst file is coverted into html
file, overall changes is listed below.

- Remove snapshot relevant changes in the SPEC.
- Fix the incorrect format which will cause the html version
  hard to read.
- Update the work items to reflect the latest changes.

Change-Id: I935ae67bca17c2eaa673d87403c0cfa8068f0922

commit_message:
Permits created guests to reach external networks

Adds MASQUERADE target on FLAT_INTERFACE in order to permit the
created guests to reach external networks.   This patch is needed
in order to avoid manual operations when testing guests connectivity.
In your local.conf file, add ALLOW_EGRESS=True in order to enable it.

Change-Id: If60d76497b19da3d936a599e142720ddcee8284b
Closes-bug: #1461228

commit_message:
fix typo for server create in server.rst

we have <security-group-list> in server create option,
while <security-group-name> in the explanation, they
both should be <security-group-name>.

Closes-Bug: #1466742
Change-Id: I26a25f57e57d8f9e19ec9c9ccb3c2b8d5396b78d

commit_message:
fix DHCP port changed when dhcp-agent restart

When DHCP server is started, the periodic task is running
before loading cache state.The method port_update_end
need to use the cache information, but the cache information
has not been loaded.

Change-Id: I0d1da11bb559b7f0f9d4428b82573fb26916a933
Closes-Bug: #1420042

commit_message:
Fix cisco_csr_identifier_map.ipsec_site_conn_id

Some database engines require exact match of sizes of foreign keys
and referenced fields. Foreign key ipsec_site_conn_id of table
cisco_csr_identifier_map is varchar(64) but it references field
id varchar(36) of table ipsec_site_connections. This gives error
while running migration scripts in such databases.

This fix only applies to new installations. Existing databases will
be corrected by migration scripts introduced in
https://review.openstack.org/190569 - they will take care of resizing
the field and adjusting the model.

Change-Id: I6cc9625a2d96d1330b06eb727cc7fa5363c697b8
Depends-On: I384a9bbaba05ef94174b666bdcfb276eedc74134
Closes-Bug: #1463806

commit_message:
Update version for Liberty

Update the version for Liberty, switching from date-based versioning
to pre-versioning using SemVer. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/065211.html
and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067082.html
for details.

commit_message:
Use correct rtslib namespace for newer versions

For rtslib-fb versions 2.1.52 and newer its own namespace (rtslib_fb) is
recommended instead of the older one (rtslib).

On versions with this new namespace a deprecation warning will be
thrown: "'rtslib' package name for rtslib-fb is deprecated, please
instead import 'rtslib_fb'"

This patch uses this new namespace when possible and falls back to the
older namespace if not.

Change-Id: I984105458da4d7b8736bf7c83919cbe5feb9c85a
Closes-Bug: #1460814

commit_message:
Fix noVNC console access for an IPv6 setup

Following a recent change in websocket proxy code
(commit: fdb73a2d445971c6158a80692c6f74094fd4193a),
novnc console access is not working for IPv6 addresses.
This patch fixes the issue by taking into account the way
IPv6 urls are constructed and parsing them accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1456963
Change-Id: Ia6c50be1e3cbe8a21f0a75b6a7cebd1712d311f8

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-19 14:16:34.000000000', 'files': ['shade/meta.py'], 'message': "Catch all exceptions around port for ip finding

commit_message:
Catch all exceptions around port for ip finding

If neutron does not work, then it's going to throw inside of list_ports,
which is going to send an OpenStackCloudException through search_ports,
which is then not going to be caught by the NeutronClientException trap
here.

commit_message:
Refactor node's and driver's vendor passthru to a common place

This patch is refactoring the node's and driver's vendor passthru in the
API to a common place (utils.py). Historically this code was duplicated
because each endpoint supported different things (driver's vendor
passhtru endpoing being always synchrounous and node's being always
asyncronous), since now both endpoints supports the same features and
the code is almost the same it makes sense to have it in a common place,
so changing once will affect both.

Related-Blueprint: ipxe-dynamic-config
Change-Id: I16be0c787993240e55ceb13b29bcb18c21151722

commit_message:
Change return value of [driver_]vendor_passthru to dict

This is a refactor patch that changes the return value of the
vendor_passthru() and driver_vendor_passthru() RPC methods to a dictionary
instead of a tuple. By doing that we make it easy to extend for future
improvements.

The RPC version was bumped to 1.29 by this change.

Change-Id: I8729bb85d97a563d4ec8409ecd0eba15dc0c51bc
Related-Blueprint: ipxe-dynamic-config

commit_message:
Adding unit test coverage for the validate method

Adding a case in the existing unit tests to cover the ValueError
exception in the validate method of the GetInput classs. Also adding
a new yaml.

Change-Id: Ib5436d2e54cf03ea1abd03e4da3bfc7c6cc12959
Closes-Bug: #1466657

commit_message:
JSCS cleanup - horizon/static/framework conf and util

We need to do cleanup before we can enable JSCS globally
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/185725/).

This patch excludes the 'util/tech-debt' folder which is
covered in patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/188316/.

Change-Id: I0b3e6435d48a24c0b24e38c96b1ce679c3268300
Partially-Implements: blueprint jscs-cleanup

commit_message:
Cinder container

Cinder is going to be split up into four containers.
- cinder-api
- cinder-scheduler
- cinder-volume
- cinder-backup

Co-Authored-By: Daneyon Hansen <danehans@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

Implements: blueprint cinder-container
Closes-bug: #1460136

Change-Id: I688471151ffa54d547b9aa0f2f2e2ea7f68f288d

commit_message:
Galera container

This changes are providing support for galera cluster. It's important for
project to has got support for database cluster as a one of the steps to
providing High Avability(HA) in Kolla project

Change-Id: If51bb88ab05972d3b8aa8abbbbd2a5480213a10e
Implemented: blueprint galera-container

revisions:

Update the version for Liberty, switching from date-based versioning
to pre-versioning using SemVer. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/065211.html
and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067082.html
for details.

Change-Id: Ida50fc2a187f08e0da53f27ae88e9ccce4f6b862
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update version for Liberty

Update the version for Liberty, switching from date-based versioning
to pre-versioning using SemVer. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/065211.html
and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067082.html
for details.

Change-Id: Ida50fc2a187f08e0da53f27ae88e9ccce4f6b862

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-19 00:48:52.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'zuul: actually enable puppet4 voting

In a previous patch, I attempted to make puppet4 jobs voting for Puppet
OpenStack modules, after Juno release.
This patch aims to actually enable the voting.

Change-Id: I77cc8b6f3c0cd3ace7485ce67c81b3a7476427fe
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
zuul: actually enable puppet4 voting

In a previous patch, I attempted to make puppet4 jobs voting for Puppet
OpenStack modules, after Juno release.
This patch aims to actually enable the voting.

Change-Id: I77cc8b6f3c0cd3ace7485ce67c81b3a7476427fe

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-17 01:41:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix beaker on Trusty and  update .gitreview file

commit_message:
Fix beaker on Trusty and  update .gitreview file

* Update .gitreview file because of Puppet OpenStack modules project
  renaming.
* Fix Beaker tests on Ubuntu Trusty (newline added if secret)

We have to do that in a single patch because:
* project has been renamed so gitreview needs to be updated
* beaker jobs are voting

Co-Authored-By: Jeremy Stanley <fungi@yuggoth.org>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sebastien Badia <sbadia@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1465780
Change-Id: If562aa5bc969c316fd8fd0cb06ed7115c465a57d

commit_message:
Add lbaas configuration opt in config-reference

neutron-lbaas has now its own repository and the configuration options have
moved in different files. This should be reflected in the admin-cloud-guide
and the configuration reference.

Change-Id: Id3c3e0c85b214114d5c98000bc5d7916c5d65b49
Closes-Bug: #1449847

commit_message:
Add client_socket_timeout option

Add a parameter to take advantage of the new(ish) eventlet socket timeout
behaviour.  Allows closing idle client connections after a period of
time, eg:

$ time nc localhost 9292
real    1m0.063s

Setting 'client_socket_timeout = 0' means do not timeout.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: 1371022
Change-Id: I9e7edcbf25ece61dc16b8cd5a8bef5ed9a14e3d6

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-19 13:47:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/disk/test_ssp.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Change set_override() calls to use flags() instead

commit_message:
Change set_override() calls to use flags() instead

A few test cases used the set_override() method to change
the CONF variables instead of self.flags().  This goes against
the nova hacking rules since it can affect down stream test
cases.

Change-Id: Iff2b38cda5cd773887f36f765013fe4adfada35b

Add Link to governance.openstack.org to docs.o.o pages

Break out the common content with "Contributor Guides" to its own
template for sharing between the various files.

Add a link to the TC documents to the Contributor Guides section.

commit_message:
Add glance_store to projects.txt

glance requires glance_store but the requirements in glance_store on
master and stable/kilo don't line up with what's in
global-requirements.txt so add glance_store to projects.txt to sync
those up.

Conflicts:
        projects.txt

Closes-Bug: #1454695
Related-Bug: #1454467

Change-Id: Ib41b0c482edf39017f26e483cd3661ca5b540133
(cherry picked from commit 64091866112ac6b3590de8b6d3c036cc03dcd6e0)

commit_message:
Clean bdms and networks after deleting shelved VM

After deleting the shelved offloaded instance with user volumes,
the bdms and networks info should be cleanup. This patch use local
deleting to cleanup the instance info.

(cherry picked from commit 54f4600c82241ad6ae6768d3dcd1e1755dac4ddc)
Conflicts:
	nova/compute/api.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

Closes-bug: #1307791
change-Id: Id32385df5b20903d7a019c3590432f3fb1133f90

[{'created': '2015-06-14 12:28:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'VMware: better exception handling

Commit 1668fef9cabea6a23023aab6b97617b4368b14d6 corrected many
wrongs that we have with the oslo.vmware exceptions. The problem
is that that patch broke nova. This patch addresses the code in
Nova to enable it to upgrade to a oslo.vmware package that has
better exception handling.

The patch does the following:
1. Ensures that place that treated VMwareDriverException will also
   treat VimFaultException. This will ensure that the code is backward
   and forward compatible
2. Fixes unit tests to ensure the above

Note: I have tested the code with oslo.vmware 0.13.0

Closes-Bug: #1459021

Change-Id: I8da60c8e31aad83f75218a3c9d49a7cd515f47f2

commit_message:
VMware: better exception handling

Commit 1668fef9cabea6a23023aab6b97617b4368b14d6 corrected many
wrongs that we have with the oslo.vmware exceptions. The problem
is that that patch broke nova. This patch addresses the code in
Nova to enable it to upgrade to a oslo.vmware package that has
better exception handling.

The patch does the following:
1. Ensures that place that treated VMwareDriverException will also
   treat VimFaultException. This will ensure that the code is backward
   and forward compatible
2. Fixes unit tests to ensure the above

Note: I have tested the code with oslo.vmware 0.13.0

Closes-Bug: #1459021

Change-Id: I8da60c8e31aad83f75218a3c9d49a7cd515f47f2

commit_message:
Adding paramiko injections check to blacklist functions

This commit adds a check for paramiko.exec_command, as it sends
the command directly to shell, and may be vulnerable to a command
injection vulnerability if called with untrusted input.  This
commit also checks paramiko.invoke_shell, which may be similarly
vulnerable.

Change-Id: I51ce997073eae94c910483790f172afdbf407e7e

(cherry picked from commit f106b6ed78a7aca688e72ca1ec094867dee1a547)

commit_message:
Fixes nova rescue / unrescue

Removes extra argument passed to _create_root_vhd by the rescue_instance
method.
Fixes the arguments passed from driver to vmops for unrescue.
Avoids deletion of 'None' file during unrescue.

Change-Id: I1636783c2681392654c6a3fcf7dd0997d6b46e1b
(cherry picked from commit f106b6ed78a7aca688e72ca1ec094867dee1a547)

commit_message:
The devref for Nova stable API

This document describes the expect of Nova REST API from Nova team. Also can
resolve some confuse what you see in the current Nova code. The Nova team will
try to reach the final goal of this document described.

Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia837bca561fa8a7c48eadfcd9bd791dc8c8d29ac

commit_message:
Removing unnecessary test setting of dashboards

HORIZON_CONFIG is still being used to set default values for
dashboards and default_dashboard. This method of specifying these
is deprecated. All of these default behaviors are now covered in
the enabled directory. Removing them to remove seeing the
deprecation warning every time tests run.

Closes-Bug: #1466671
Change-Id: Ifd833288f0bf2992bd810a93a74a799232f119ab

commit_message:
Pass proxy environment variables to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox fails even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem by passing (upper case and lower case)
http_proxy, https_proxy and no_proxy from environment to tox.

See: commit 2d02ebb775ec44a14e325c56d4a901c5705fbb94

Change-Id: Ib7964fd5ea4fb8398cdb4cd94a70fe7fae49f973

commit_message:
[Manila] Add scenario for creation/deletion of Manila share networks

List of changes:
- Added support of 'create' and 'delete' operations for share networks.
- Added benchmark for creating and deleting share networks.

Change-Id: I25ffb2d8d769f6d81972f8773951246f11abb2a0

subject: Fix unicode/bytes issues in API v2 tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 6924, 'name': 'Pradeep Kilambi', 'email': 'pkilambi@redhat.com', 'username': 'pkilambi'}, {'_account_id': 7729, 'name': 'Ilya Tyaptin', 'email': 'ityaptin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ityaptin'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-15 16:43:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix Python 3 issues in tests.api.v2

* CombinationEvaluator: on Python 3, convert states (built using zip) to
  a list because states is consumed more than once. On Python 3, zip()
  returns an iterator which can only be consumed once.
* HTTP body is a bytes string: fix unit tests to use bytes instead of
  native string (Unicode on Python 3).
* test_alarm_scenarios: format key and value representation at runtime
  instead of using hardcoded value because repr(u'abc) doesn't start
  with u'...' prefix anymore on Python 3.
* Replace dict.keys()[0] with list(dict.keys())[0]. On Python 3, keys()
  returns an iterator which is not indexable.
* test_list_meters_scenarios: base64.encodestring() returns a byte
  string whereas the test expects a native string (so Unicode on
  Python 3). On Python 3, decode the string from ASCII to get Unicode.
* AggregatorTransformer: replace dict.values() with list(dict.values())
  to get a copy of the list of values on Python 3, instead of a view
  (still connected to the dictionary).
* Add the following tests of ceilometer.tests.api.v2 to tox -e py34:

  - test_alarm_scenarios.TestAlarms.test_alarms_query_with_timestamp
  - test_complex_query
  - test_complex_query_scenarios.TestQueryMetersController.test_query_with_isotime

Note: The test_list_meters_scenarios and test_statistics_scenarios tests
of ceilometer.tests.api.v2 cannot be executed by testtools.run.

Change-Id: I8258c2d17fbc1236f4bcda40bff93a93bddf13e2
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-15 16:52:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix Python 3 issues in tests.api.v2

* CombinationEvaluator: on Python 3, convert states (built using zip) to
  a list because states is consumed more than once. On Python 3, zip()
  returns an iterator which can only be consumed once.
* HTTP body is a bytes string: fix unit tests to use bytes instead of
  native string (Unicode on Python 3).
* test_alarm_scenarios: format key and value representation at runtime
  instead of using hardcoded value because repr(u'abc) doesn't start
  with u'...' prefix anymore on Python 3.
* Replace dict.keys()[0] with list(dict.keys())[0]. On Python 3, keys()
  returns an iterator which is not indexable.
* test_list_meters_scenarios: base64.encodestring() returns a byte
  string whereas the test expects a native string (so Unicode on
  Python 3). On Python 3, decode the string from ASCII to get Unicode.
* AggregatorTransformer: replace dict.values() with list(dict.values())
  to get a copy of the list of values on Python 3, instead of a view
  (still connected to the dictionary).
* Add the following tests of ceilometer.tests.api.v2 to tox -e py34:

  - test_alarm_scenarios.TestAlarms.test_alarms_query_with_timestamp
  - test_complex_query
  - test_complex_query_scenarios.TestQueryMetersController.test_query_with_isotime

Note: The test_list_meters_scenarios and test_statistics_scenarios tests
of ceilometer.tests.api.v2 cannot be executed by testtools.run.

Change-Id: I8258c2d17fbc1236f4bcda40bff93a93bddf13e2
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-06-15 21:38:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix Python 3 issues in tests.api.v2

* CombinationEvaluator: on Python 3, convert states (built using zip) to
  a list because states is consumed more than once. On Python 3, zip()
  returns an iterator which can only be consumed once.
* HTTP body is a bytes string: fix unit tests to use bytes instead of
  native string (Unicode on Python 3).
* test_alarm_scenarios: format key and value representation at runtime
  instead of using hardcoded value because repr(u'abc) doesn't start
  with u'...' prefix anymore on Python 3.
* Replace dict.keys()[0] with list(dict.keys())[0]. On Python 3, keys()
  returns an iterator which is not indexable.
* test_list_meters_scenarios: base64.encodestring() returns a byte
  string whereas the test expects a native string (so Unicode on
  Python 3). On Python 3, decode the string from ASCII to get Unicode.
* AggregatorTransformer: replace dict.values() with list(dict.values())
  to get a copy of the list of values on Python 3, instead of a view
  (still connected to the dictionary).
* Add the following tests of ceilometer.tests.api.v2 to tox -e py34:

  - test_complex_query
  - test_complex_query_scenarios.TestQueryMetersController.test_query_with_isotime
  - test_list_resources_scenarios.TestListResources.test_with_invalid_resource_id

* test_list_meters_scenarios: decode JSON data (HTTP body) from UTF-8.
  json.loads() requires Unicode on Python 3.

Note: The test_list_meters_scenarios and test_statistics_scenarios tests
of ceilometer.tests.api.v2 cannot be executed by testtools.run.

commit_message:
Fix unicode/bytes issues in API v2 tests

* HTTP body type is bytes: fix tests to use bytes strings.
* test_list_resources_scenarios: on Python 3, base64.encodestring() returns
  bytes whereas the test expects bytes; decode the result from ASCII.
* tox.ini: add the following API v2 tests to Python 3.4:

  - test_alarm_scenarios.TestAlarms.test_alarms_query_with_timestamp
  - test_complex_query_scenarios.TestQueryMetersController.test_query_with_isotime
  - test_list_resources_scenarios.TestListResources.test_with_invalid_resource_id

Change-Id: I8258c2d17fbc1236f4bcda40bff93a93bddf13e2

commit_message:
Fix up README to work with the release tools

Add links to the bug tracker and source in a way the release script can
find them.

Move the contributing instructions to a separate file, where github will
pick them up and the release tools won't be confused by the urls.

Change-Id: Icbc1fdde3245ef6aa750bd44601adb1514763034

commit_message:
Add 'docker' to the list of known hypervisor types

nova-docker is out of tree, but it's starting to be used by people, and
being able to use a docker-specific hypervisor type can be quite useful
(in mixed-hypervisor environments, for instance).

Change-Id: I5a50de6bf73372f1ab999fd977aa58b33ffacfb9
(cherry picked from commit 2a21fcd073b44eb32f821fe3eb938dba7c34f6bc)

subject: Running with 'LIBS_FROM_GIT=pbr' causes failure
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-18 16:30:44.000000000', 'files': ['lib/infra'], 'message': 'Running with 'LIBS_FROM_GIT=pbr' causes failure

If you have 'pbr' in your LIBS_FROM_GIT list, then the following error
occurs:

+ cd /opt/stack/requirements
/home/ubuntu/devstack/inc/python: line 229: cd: /opt/stack/requirements:
No such file or directory

This is due to commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/192494 moving
the clone of 'requirements' after 'setup_lib "pbr"' - which depends
on the directory existing.

The fix is to move the clone back before the pbr section,
leaving the pip_install for afterwards.

Change-Id: I04bd887d3c8157533f79cb737d040a5803c7a9dd
Closes-Bug: #1466577
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Running with 'LIBS_FROM_GIT=pbr' causes failure

If you have 'pbr' in your LIBS_FROM_GIT list, then the following error
occurs:

+ cd /opt/stack/requirements
/home/ubuntu/devstack/inc/python: line 229: cd: /opt/stack/requirements:
No such file or directory

This is due to commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/192494 moving
the clone of 'requirements' after 'setup_lib "pbr"' - which depends
on the directory existing.

The fix is to move the clone back before the pbr section,
leaving the pip_install for afterwards.

Change-Id: I04bd887d3c8157533f79cb737d040a5803c7a9dd
Closes-Bug: #1466577

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-19 00:19:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Strip markers from test requirements.

Setuptools doesn't [yet] support markeres in tests_require parameters
to setup(). While we need to get that fixed, we also need to support
syncing marker constrained requirements from global-requirements.

Since version constraints are needed to successfully port to Python3
this won't be a long term viable solution: but few (none today) of our
test-only dependencies require version constraints, so we can do this
in the interim.

Change-Id: I31adaf35c8d7b72fe3f8c9242cc356fe34d537e8
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-19 01:59:45.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/packaging.py', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/test-requirements.txt', 'pbr/hooks/backwards.py'], 'message': "Strip markers from test requirements.

Setuptools doesn't [yet] support markeres in tests_require parameters
to setup(). While we need to get that fixed, we also need to support
syncing marker constrained requirements from global-requirements.

Since version constraints are needed to successfully port to Python3
this won't be a long term viable solution: but few of our test-only
dependencies require version constraints, so we can do this in the
interim. The ones that do - such as python-mysql - we're either
moving away from, or centralising them into optional dependencies

Change-Id: I31adaf35c8d7b72fe3f8c9242cc356fe34d537e8
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Strip markers from test requirements.

Setuptools doesn't [yet] support markeres in tests_require parameters
to setup(). While we need to get that fixed, we also need to support
syncing marker constrained requirements from global-requirements.

Since version constraints are needed to successfully port to Python3
this won't be a long term viable solution: but few of our test-only
dependencies require version constraints, so we can do this in the
interim. The ones that do - such as python-mysql - we're either
moving away from, or centralising them into optional dependencies
on other packages where the tests_require limitation shouldn't apply.

Change-Id: I31adaf35c8d7b72fe3f8c9242cc356fe34d537e8

commit_message:
Adding ResellerAdmin role to Ceilometer user

Swift polling requires ResellerAdmin role to be added to the
Ceilometer user. This was already added to register_endpoint.sh
so it needs to be also in os-cloud-config.

Change-Id: Ie31fe2828991e7f277b56a962de8fb0c20e5f410

commit_message:
Test if Undercloud Ceilometer monitors Overcloud

A simple test if some hardware meter has been created inside
Ceilometer. That means Ceilometer has been able to poll the
statistics from at least one Overcloud Node.

Depends on Ceilometer patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/92370/

Change-Id: I0dcfa03b3aa69cc2a83566757ebcace6eb62dd16

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-24 10:47:54.000000000', 'files': ['elements/snmpd/README.md', 'elements/snmpd/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/67-snmpd'], 'message': 'Allowing to optionally run sensors-detect

Allowing to optionally run sensors-detect feature in lm-sensors.
If passing run_sensors_detect parameter through heat, sensors-detect
will be invoked with default input.
According to documentation this step is mandatory, though sensors
might be visible after installing lm-sensors without running detect.

Change-Id: I8e361b60fce8215d0e4666c8c38c86985dda8261
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allowing to optionally run sensors-detect

Allowing to optionally run sensors-detect feature in lm-sensors.
If passing run_sensors_detect parameter through heat, sensors-detect
will be invoked with default input.
According to documentation this step is mandatory, though sensors
might be visible after installing lm-sensors without running detect.

Change-Id: I8e361b60fce8215d0e4666c8c38c86985dda8261

commit_message:
Allowing system level stats

Adding 1.3.6.1.4.1.2021 for total_swap, avail_swap, cpu_idle
io_raw_sent and io_raw_received.

Adding 1.3.6.1.2.1.4 for ip_out_requests and ip_in_requests.

Change-Id: I581371d2679f8f2aaec8eec5dcf3048610ee88c7

commit_message:
Switch to os-cloud-config register-endpoints

Switching to os-cloud-config register-endpoints. Changing interface
to new one.

Endpoints will be created exatly the same as before, so this change
is backwards compatible.

Roles are created as part of register endpoints now.

Depends on:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/132983/
Without this patch there is failure while uploading image
using Overcloud Glance.

Change-Id: I90c5fd909459e2e41641fd49ce6ea00cc554de8e

Added method for connect to node and run command

Added method for connect to node on ssh and run command
on this host. This is change need for adding custom
scenario to scenario tests
bp custom-checks

commit_message:
Replace xrange() with six.moves.range()

Add "from six.moves import range" to replace the builtin range()
function with six.moves.range() to always create an iterator, instead of
creating a temporary list.

Replace "xrange" with "range".

Don't add the import for ranges of 1024 items or less.

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: If618b4e810e444f7eb6592bb2398805e9d14d548

removed safely.

commit_message:
metricd: start several processes to process more metric

This starts one process per CPU to maximize throughput in metric
treatment.

Change-Id: Iccc7e619cb9ed00bd010e66d1bdc009efe10b7f2

commit_message:
libvirt: adjust test_get_disk_bus test to ImageMetaProps object

test_get_disk_bus test is incompatible with the new
ImageMetaProps object, as None values for the hw_cdrom_bus field
are not allowed.
Adjusting the test to not set the properties instead,
as it has the same effect.

Change-Id: I1ef5c235fcf7fbc3f2780c3b93344c9506b952f7

commit_message:
objects: raise a meaningful exception when validating VIF properties

Raise an UnsupportedVIFModel exception in the fields object
when validating the VIF values.

This will allow to re-raise a meaningful exception.

Closes-Bug: #1463655
Change-Id: I5dadfbfa1a7970977cffaa63a4cbff663edb7197

commit_message:
libvirt: adjust os_command_empty test to ImageMetaProps object

test_get_guest_config_os_command_empty is incompatible with the new
ImageMetaProps object, as empty values are not for os_command_line field
are not allowed.
Adjusting the test to test against an empty image properties, instead of
an empty vaule, as it has the same effect.

Closes-Bug: #1463651
Change-Id: I5f493e3d923544498dde22ee92d83d71460767e1

  getting it from __builtin__ to mock the open() function. The

* sanitize_hostname(): on Python 3, decode back the hostname from Latin1
  to work on a native string (Unicode)
* replace reduce() with six.moves.reduce(): the Python 2 builtin
  reduce() function was moved to the functools module in Python 3
* convert_version_to_str(): fix integer division, use a//b, not a/b
* convert_version_to_str(): replace reduce() with ''.join() with map(str)

commit_message:
Fix Python 3 issues in utils

* Replace string.split(key_file, ',') with key_file.split(','):
  the string.split() function was removed in Python 3, use the
  str.split() method instead
* Fix conf_fixture: import backup_enable_progress_timer and
  backup_swift_enable_progress_timer options. This change is required
  to run tests using testtools (it's now possible yet to run tests on
  Python 3 using testr).
* hash_file(): use b'' (bytes) for the sentinel, not '' (unicode), when
  reading the input binary file
* test_hash_file() requires a binary file (bytes), not a text file
  (unicode)
* Get the builtin open() function from six.moves.builtins instead of
  getting it from __builtin__ to mock the open() function. The
  __builtin__ module was renamed to builtins in Python 3.
* sanitize_hostname(): on Python 3, decode back the hostname from Latin1
  to work on a native string (Unicode)
* replace reduce() with six.moves.reduce(): the Python 2 builtin
  reduce() function was moved to the functools module in Python 3
* convert_version_to_str(): fix integer division, use a//b, not a/b
* convert_version_to_str(): replace reduce() with ''.join() with map(str)

Blueprint cinder-python3

Skip test_sahara_image_registry while investigating reasons

Currently we have test_sahara_image_registry failing the gate.
It will require time to investigate and fix it.
While so I suggest we disable it so it wouldn't -1 everyone.

subject: Close connections from SegmentedIterable on client disconnection
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-18 16:17:12.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/request_helpers.py'], 'message': 'Close connections from SegmentedIterable on client disconnection

SegmentedIterable is used to retrieve segments from DLO and SLO objects. When
a client disconnect during the download of a segment, the connection to the
object server is not closed.

This commit add a close() method to SegmentedIterable that is called on a
client disconnection. Thus, proxy server does not leak connections anymore.

Change-Id: I598fb7c50f626bb065f70f62b6f9d32d6b18749f
Closes-Bug: #1466549
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Close connections from SegmentedIterable on client disconnection

SegmentedIterable is used to retrieve segments from DLO and SLO objects. When
a client disconnect during the download of a segment, the connection to the
object server is not closed.

This commit add a close() method to SegmentedIterable that is called on a
client disconnection. Thus, proxy server does not leak connections anymore.

Change-Id: I598fb7c50f626bb065f70f62b6f9d32d6b18749f
Closes-Bug: #1466549

commit_message:
Drop L suffix from long integers

Replace 123L with 123 to make Cinder code compatible with Python 3.

This patch was generated by the long operation of the sixer tool:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sixer

Manual changes:

* hp_3par_common: bump version

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I3086d3e3d9c3ede358313bdd43d1eee9cfdafe15

commit_message:
libvirt: handle code=38 + sigkill (ebusy) in destroy()

Handle the libvirt error during destroy when the sigkill fails due to an
EBUSY. This is taken from a comment by danpb in the bug report as a
potential workaround.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Berrange (berrange@redhat.com)

Closes-Bug: #1353939

Change-Id: I128bf6b939fbbc85df521fd3fe23c3c6f93b1b2c

commit_message:
Reattach the original configdrive during unrescue

At the moment, the instance original configdrive is not reattached
when the instance is unrescued. This behavior can be undesired.

This patch fixes the issue by reattaching the instance configdrive
during the unrescue operation, in case it exists.

Change-Id: I82e2b31139d947a4201c770db37d84b83bba282a
(cherry picked from commit 3a2b460c1e552812c8e7694954c12dfe3b9e3a97)

commit_message:
Reattach the original configdrive during unrescue

At the moment, the instance original configdrive is not reattached
when the instance is unrescued. This behavior can be undesired.

This patch fixes the issue by reattaching the instance configdrive
during the unrescue operation, in case it exists.

Change-Id: I82e2b31139d947a4201c770db37d84b83bba282a

subject: Fixes nova rescue / unrescue
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-19 00:54:55.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/vmops.py', 'hyperv/nova/driver.py'], 'message': "Fixes nova rescue / unrescue

Removes extra argument passed to _create_root_vhd by the rescue_instance
method.
Fixes the arguments passed from driver to vmops for unrescue.
Avoids deletion of 'None' file during unrescue.

Change-Id: I1636783c2681392654c6a3fcf7dd0997d6b46e1b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes nova rescue / unrescue

Removes extra argument passed to _create_root_vhd by the rescue_instance
method.
Fixes the arguments passed from driver to vmops for unrescue.
Avoids deletion of 'None' file during unrescue.

Change-Id: I1636783c2681392654c6a3fcf7dd0997d6b46e1b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 156, 'name': 'Ryu Ishimoto', 'email': 'ryu@midokura.com', 'username': 'ryu-midokura'}, {'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 7505, 'name': 'Jaume Devesa', 'email': 'devvesa@gmail.com', 'username': 'devesa'}, {'_account_id': 8837, 'name': 'Joe Mills', 'email': 'joe.h.mills@gmail.com', 'username': 'joemido'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-17 17:52:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use UPLINK net type instead of LOCAL

Previously, 'LOCAL' network type was used to determine whether a
Neutron network is an uplink network or not. This caused a problem in
Neutron because all admin-owned networks must have a type, and it
always defaulted to 'LOCAL', making it impossible to differentiate
uplink and normal networks.  To get around it, this patch defines a new
type 'UPLINK' to replace 'LOCAL'.

Change-Id: Ifb0dbe8d2c86456b11064c786f8ebe6e4126d206
Implements: MNP-150
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-18 02:06:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use UPLINK net type instead of LOCAL

Previously, 'LOCAL' network type was used to determine whether a
Neutron network is an uplink network or not. This caused a problem in
Neutron because all admin-owned networks must have a type, and it
always defaulted to 'LOCAL', making it impossible to differentiate
uplink and normal networks.  To get around it, this patch defines a new
type 'UPLINK' to replace 'LOCAL'.

Change-Id: Ifb0dbe8d2c86456b11064c786f8ebe6e4126d206
Implements: MNP-150
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-06-18 02:11:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use UPLINK net type instead of LOCAL

Previously, 'LOCAL' network type was used to determine whether a
Neutron network is an uplink network or not. This caused a problem in
Neutron because all external networks when 'provider' extension is
enabled must have a type, and it always defaulted to 'LOCAL', making it
impossible to differentiate uplink and external networks.  To get
around it, this patch defines a new type 'UPLINK' to replace
'LOCAL'.

Change-Id: Ifb0dbe8d2c86456b11064c786f8ebe6e4126d206
Implements: MNP-150
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-06-18 03:01:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use UPLINK net type instead of LOCAL

Previously, 'LOCAL' network type was used to determine whether a
Neutron network is an uplink network or not. This caused a problem in
Neutron because, following the behavior of ML2, all external networks
when 'providernet' extension is enabled must have a type, and it always
defaulted to 'LOCAL' unless explicitly specified to something else,
making it impossible to differentiate uplink and external networks.  To
get around it, this patch defines a new type 'UPLINK' to replace
'LOCAL'.

Change-Id: Ifb0dbe8d2c86456b11064c786f8ebe6e4126d206
Implements: MNP-150
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-06-18 03:34:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use UPLINK net type instead of LOCAL

Previously, 'LOCAL' network type was used to determine whether a
Neutron network is an uplink network or not. This caused a problem in
Neutron because, following the behavior of ML2, all external networks
when 'providernet' extension is enabled usually have a type, and
typically configured to have 'LOCAL' as the default, unless explicitly
specified, making it impossible to differentiate uplink and external
networks.  To get around it, this patch defines a new type 'UPLINK' to
replace 'LOCAL'.

Change-Id: Ifb0dbe8d2c86456b11064c786f8ebe6e4126d206
Implements: MNP-150
", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-06-18 10:30:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use UPLINK net type instead of LOCAL

Previously, 'LOCAL' network type was used to determine whether a
Neutron network is an uplink network or not. This caused a problem in
Neutron because, following the behavior of ML2, all external networks
when 'providernet' extension is enabled usually have a type, and
typically configured to have 'LOCAL' as the default, unless explicitly
specified, making it impossible to differentiate uplink and external
networks.  To get around it, this patch defines a new type 'UPLINK' to
replace 'LOCAL'.  Also, instead of validating against the unsupported
types, just log and continue.  This way, 'providernet' extension could
continue to be used with Horizon, until it is patched to accept uplink
type.

Change-Id: Ifb0dbe8d2c86456b11064c786f8ebe6e4126d206
Implements: MNP-150

Implements: MNP-150
", 'number': 8}]
commit_message:
Use UPLINK net type instead of LOCAL

Previously, 'LOCAL' network type was used to determine whether a
Neutron network is an uplink network or not. This caused a problem in
Neutron because, following the behavior of ML2, all external networks
when 'providernet' extension is enabled usually have a type, and
typically configured to have 'LOCAL' as the default, unless explicitly
specified, making it impossible to differentiate uplink and external
networks.  To get around it, this patch defines a new type 'UPLINK' to
replace 'LOCAL'.  Also, instead of validating against the unsupported
types, just log and continue.  This way, 'providernet' extension could
continue to be used with Horizon, until it is patched to accept uplink
type.

Change-Id: Ifb0dbe8d2c86456b11064c786f8ebe6e4126d206
Implements: MNP-150

commit_message:
Make test_rest keystone cache work with keystonemiddleware 2.0

Token cache keys in keystonemiddleware 2.0 are sha256 hashes of the
token key. This is _not_ the case in keystonemiddleware <2.0. This
change adjusts the FakeMemcache to support both types of key.

keystonemiddleware also breaks WebTest linting, so turn that off
until there has been progress on fixing that.

Change-Id: I28b5dbfbc915d424c74993732ddc041e528903e6

commit_message:
Re-add DRBD driver

This reverts commit 37eef0b3d4d786d4b2b1a7e48f3e2339506e85e2.

We hope to have a -infra CI running by June 12th, to get included
in Liberty.

Change-Id: Icb7347d55dc5b22720269405b6d2b4053c2ad819

commit_message:
6.1 -- Consume External Ubuntu

Add instructions on how change a path for
Ubuntu system packages.
Add to new features that the Ubuntu
system packages can now be downloaded
from official Ubuntu mirrors or
from internal repos.

Change-Id: Ic0bc99a5d0af7c0e870509f77df17c311cf56b90

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-02 06:13:45.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Ensure tests run under python2.7

tox uses whatever python version that tox ran with as the default python
version for environments (py27,py3x, etc are given a more specific
default).

Debian's python-tox (for example) uses python3, but we require python2.7
- and a naive `apt-get install python-tox; tox -epep8` fails with
py3-related errors on Debian.

This change explicitly sets `basepython = python2.7` in several testing
environments that would otherwise have used the default basepython.

Change-Id: I377ac6d72dec5b85c105d8a1a74f6974efb84dcf
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ensure tests run under python2.7

tox uses whatever python version that tox ran with as the default python
version for environments (py27,py3x, etc are given a more specific
default).

Debian's python-tox (for example) uses python3, but we require python2.7
- and a naive `apt-get install python-tox; tox -epep8` fails with
py3-related errors on Debian.

This change explicitly sets `basepython = python2.7` in several testing
environments that would otherwise have used the default basepython.

Change-Id: I377ac6d72dec5b85c105d8a1a74f6974efb84dcf

commit_message:
Expose current clean step in the API

Bumps the API version to 1.7 to expose node.clean_step.

Closes-Bug: #1466693
Change-Id: I2d909211e7fe0d3eb3fb4466051eb12bdf351543

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-22 19:03:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Local centos mirror with priorities

Change-Id: I84a893a32194f0d6f5c2727af373f680fae1aaae
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-23 13:15:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Added priorities for centos repos

We need to be able to download packages from
various repositories taking into account repository
priority. We need this for patching story.

This patch introduces MULTI_MIRROR_CENTOS variable
which is supposed to have the following format:

"name1,pri1,url1 name2,pri2,url2"

Besides, this patch introduces uniformity for all those
cases USE_MIRROR=msk|srt|none removing unused variables.

It is supposed that USE_MIRROR=none is only used for
building Centos mirror not for building ISO.

Change-Id: I84a893a32194f0d6f5c2727af373f680fae1aaae
Closes-Bug: #1446293

commit_message:
Added priorities for centos repos

We need to be able to download packages from
various repositories taking into account repository
priority. We need this for patching story.

This patch introduces MULTI_MIRROR_CENTOS variable
which is supposed to have the following format:

  "name1,url1,pri1 name2,url2,pri2"

In case when pri is not defined it will be set to 10,
for example
  "name1,url1"
        is equal to:
  "name1,url1,10"

Besides, this patch introduces uniformity for all those
cases USE_MIRROR=msk|srt|none removing unused variables.

It is supposed that USE_MIRROR=none is only used for
building Centos mirror not for building ISO.

Change-Id: I84a893a32194f0d6f5c2727af373f680fae1aaae
Closes-Bug: #1446293

commit_message:
Implement service_region user_group_var

Currently each service has an individual service_region var
which needs to be set when setting up a region that is
different to the default.

This patch implements a user_group_var called 'service_region'
which can be used to set the region for all services.

The AIO bootstrap script is also altered to set the
service_region in the user config.

Change-Id: I5ed216916f667506ffed900a01744dad973221bf
Closes-Bug: #1463366

commit_message:
Update rabbitmq to v3.5.3-1

This change updates rabbitmq to the latest stable rabbitmq release
the new version is v3.5.3-1 and is being done to ensure that we are
maintaining a stable release with updated bug fixes and patches.

commit_message:
Allow protocol to be set per endpoint-type

If services are running behind an SSL terminating LB you will want to
differentiate between protocol on internalURL and publicURL endpoints.
This patch allows you to set the values of protocol per endpoint type,
but doesn't change the default behaviour which is to have it set in one
var.

Change-Id: I7a74c85a8841499623746586ae27103a71c6fec0
Partial-Bug: #1399383
(cherry picked from commit 1a2907c6a137bc4bc110f971f34904a20a7a5ad4)

commit_message:
Nodes metadata filtration added

Filtering of private nodes metadata added to statsender.
This patchset is only for syncronization of code in stable/6.1 and master.
Current whitelists implementation is not fit to fix this issue due to
meatdata data structure. Filtration by whitelists is going to be implemened
in: https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1466121

Change-Id: I2c5f39e0ac0f77c281db444933ac54723c2645c7
Closes-Bug: #1466140

commit_message:
Split environment file into component parts

This patch splits the monolithic openstack_environment file
into component parts, making them easier to understand and
manipulate.

Change-Id: I45887599bd887a272798047f9ad650d4811ab380
Closes-Bug: #1463862
(cherry picked from commit ecf77297955922d31dfaa3e6570bd6589f759b2f)

commit_message:
Block additionalProperties on Nova API tests

Now Nova team is allowing additional properties with microversions
only, that means Nova v2 and v2.1 should not contain additional
properties forever. In addition, we should not allow vender-specific
properties for OpenStack interoperability.
This patch disables additionalProperties for blocking such properties
for v2 and v2.1 API.

Change-Id: Ica929c402a3d042ae751302384e68853eb28b405

Adds FC and ISCSI Cinder drivers for DotHill Storage Arrays

DocImpact

This change fixes the py_pkgs plugin so that if the plugin loads an empty file
or if there is an exception raised when loading the contents of a yaml file
the item will be skipped and no bad data will be passed onto the rest of the
plugin.

Change-Id: Ica3af42d95e7f3140e437e388b25f41bc14db47f
Closes-Bug: #1464673
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixed empty yaml load

This change fixes the py_pkgs plugin so that if the plugin loads an empty file
or if there is an exception raised when loading the contents of a yaml file
the item will be skipped and no bad data will be passed onto the rest of the
plugin.

Change-Id: Ica3af42d95e7f3140e437e388b25f41bc14db47f
Closes-Bug: #1464673

commit_message:
Dynamic index.rst for specs

Build doc/source/index.rst dynamically based on the subdirectories in specs/
directory that correspond to release version numbers. This allows to submit
specs for new releases without manually creating a toctree.

Header and footer templates added for building doc/source/index.rst file.

Change-Id: I1985c1e770be3430a3699832d7b5b056dbf1faa9

Stop Haproxy listen to 35357 for public.

Stop Haproxy listen to 35357 port on public
interface. Admin endpoint should not be exposed on public.

commit_message:
Revert "Change default IO scheduler to deadline"

This reverts commit ec917ae36d2a1b482b189f29483cfdbc5ce700be.

As shown by simple benchmark on Launchpad report[1], the change has decreased the performance.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1418126/comments/14

Change-Id: I087952152ff522c343bb209413c9905b2d4b1f29

commit_message:
Increase threshold for running processes for zabbix

Modern OS can run much more than 300 processes, so zabbix warns every
time about it. Increased value to 500.

Change-Id: Icbcfa2009e312a66c84f3de5f16b53c95052553b
Closes-Bug: #1434118

command which is run on the 'victim' controller
to check pacemaker reaction.

commit_message:
Do not add @domain_name to dnsmasq.conf if it equals 'local'

Currently dnsmasq tries to resolve locally a host named
test.mydomain.local instead of forwarding this request to the local dns
server.

Change-Id: I5892fddaffa0dc619f0a54ac0f9fac34055b9b3f
Closes-Bug: 1411425
(cherry picked from commit 3ca3ef5aae68b84ec8b9beb55e552bdd70d42599)

commit_message:
We forgot two of our cookbooks and our specs

In the move to the OpenStack namespace we forgot two of our cookbooks,
and our specs repo.

- cookbook-openstack-database
- cookbook-openstack-identity
- openstack-chef-specs

This patch brings them across for us.

Change-Id: I268a0d73dc2427db45cf5c91c6e9ee4e8b3e1d9b

subject: Rename python-keystoneclient-saml2 to keystoneauth
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-11 12:39:13.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Rename python-keystoneclient-saml2 to keystoneauth

With the ``keystoneauth`` library to be released soon we want our SAML2
authentication plugins to depend on that library, instead of
``python-keystoneclient``. For that we propose changing repository name to
``keystoneauth-saml2`` so it reflects proper hierarchy between
libraries.

This library has never had a release so will not have an impact on
users.

Change-Id: Iddf0e280c1b3513db0700c65e0f912da93119286
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rename python-keystoneclient-saml2 to keystoneauth

With the ``keystoneauth`` library to be released soon we want our SAML2
authentication plugins to depend on that library, instead of
``python-keystoneclient``. For that we propose changing repository name to
``keystoneauth-saml2`` so it reflects proper hierarchy between
libraries.

This library has never had a release so will not have an impact on
users.

Change-Id: Iddf0e280c1b3513db0700c65e0f912da93119286

commit_message:
Spec to add 'libvirt_net' as vif type to novas libvirt driver.

This is required in order to attach libvirt manged kvm guests to
a libvirt managed network.

Change-Id: Ib88ad3309ae136e621545e29f301cdae51e47f60
Implements: blueprint libvirt-network-vif

commit_message:
Rectify default config values for nsx plugin

This patch corrects some values for the nsx_sync section, as well
as other configuration options used for connecting to the controller
cluster.

Change-Id: I2e70dc56c3fd493ef4b6111e4041fffc8419b856
Closes-Bug: #1465754

commit_message:
convergence: (temporary) convert int entity_id to string

We plan to change the schema of entity_id to int (as all
resource.id's are int and represent the stack.id as "0".

Until that change is done, this is a "quick fix" to make things
work.

Change-Id: I99ddc14d68b7cc0869d5bb636c06f4498344cf3d

Make sure default_client_name declared for required resources

which does not explicitly declare it.

commit_message:
Use PyMySQL in MySQL related functional/fullstack tests

mysql-python driver has been replaced by PyMySQL driver[1] in neutron
code but MySQL related functional/fullstack tests try to use
mysql-python driver because of MySQLOpportunisticTestCase[2] and tests
are skipped because mysql-python driver is no more available.

This change provides a backend implementation for mysql+pymysql, a base
base testcase MySQLTestCase[2] using mysql+pymysql implementation
(currently oslo.db provides none of them but will in the future) and
replaces MySQLOpportunisticTestCase with MySQLTestCase.

[1] I73e0fdb6eca70e7d029a40a2f6f17a7c0797a21d
[2] neutron.tests.common.base

Closes-Bug: #1463980
Change-Id: Ic5c1d12ab75443e1cc290a7447eeb4b452b4a9dd

subject: Fixes Hyper-V agent stateful security group rules
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-16 20:29:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes Hyper-V agent stateful security group rules

Hyper-V does not allow stateful ACLs with "ANY" protocol, meaning that
security group rules which allows "ANY" protocol must be split up
into separate rules for each protocol.
Also, Hyper-V does not allow stateful ICMP rules, which means ICMP rules
must be added both inbound and outbound.

Closes-Bug: #1362676

Change-Id: I0d4a6ebc6023ea616cf92539273b8b36a6b24ae0

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V agent stateful security group rules

Hyper-V does not allow stateful ACLs with "ANY" protocol, meaning that
security group rules which allows "ANY" protocol must be split up
into separate rules for each protocol.
Also, Hyper-V does not allow stateful ICMP rules, which means ICMP rules
must be added both inbound and outbound.

Closes-Bug: #1362676

Change-Id: I0d4a6ebc6023ea616cf92539273b8b36a6b24ae0

commit_message:
Path to mysql-wss script in DB backup/restore doc

In the Fuel 6.1 Operations Guide, path to mysql-wss is incorrect in
db-backup-ops.rst file.

It is now /usr/lib/ocf/resource.d/fuel/mysql-wss, not
/usr/lib/ocf/resource.d/mirantis/mysql-wss.

Change-Id: I0aa561a9803493da45e0b023b5623f540e03de08
Closes-bug: 1464755
(cherry picked from commit a817f83b26c3a8f8dd2932a589feee5631ae96d1)

commit_message:
Add delete_network retres for v2

For plugin V2, earlier patches to have retries on error in
delete_network method was never applied.

The patches are: 0126e13 and d2fe565

Add the same retry logic for v2 in this patch.

Change-Id: I4db62889a29678f1cdccd660bb6dfc4b9d049511
Fixes: MNP-151

commit_message:
Updating Case Studies - Creating dashboard case studies

This creates case studies for both Alice and Bob in the Dashboard
chapter. This outlines Alice's work around HTST, sub domains, and
other configurations. Bob's case studies are coming, however
Alice's can be used in the meantime. Linking through the Dashboard
chapter as well.

Co-Authored-By: Dave Walker <email@daviey.com>
Change-Id: I6569d0dcb0fc6e0ba07a54e3631b58f76e5857ef
Partial-Bug: #1349540

subject: remove extra_extensions config
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-11 01:59:53.000000000', 'files': ['midonet/neutron/plugin.py', 'midonet/neutron/tests/unit/test_midonet_plugin.py', 'midonet/neutron/common/config.py'], 'message': 'remove extra_extensions config

The list of available extensions does not need to be configurable
due to a recent decision to separate the plugin packages, each of
which will have a static list of supported extensions.

This patch removes that configuration option, and adds all of the
supported extensions to the static list.

Change-Id: Ib5cf3e464bebf77815e0aa896bea187bd43b5ddf
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
remove extra_extensions config

The list of available extensions does not need to be configurable
due to a recent decision to separate the plugin packages, each of
which will have a static list of supported extensions.

This patch removes that configuration option, and adds all of the
supported extensions to the static list.

Change-Id: Ib5cf3e464bebf77815e0aa896bea187bd43b5ddf
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded http in URL in sahara exercise script

The script hardcoded http://$SERVICE_HOST/... which failed
when SSL or tls-proxy was enabled. Calculate the protocol
based on enabled services instead.

Change-Id: I192eeeafe7bf4dc5cbd382c505ffb9307651d78a

commit_message:
Make sure iptables-services is installed

The iptables service files are no longer included by default on
Fedora.  This causes the systemctl calls in fixup_stuff.sh to fail
when disabling firewalld in favor of iptables.

Change-Id: If37691d03e3d07ca8b53c541717081beeb184c16
Closes-Bug: #1462347

subject: Remove file-driver special no-async abilities
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-17 16:21:18.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/file.py'], 'message': 'Remove file-driver special no-async abilities

To enable a following commit to unify the `run_watchers` of
the various drivers we need to make the file driver method
look more like the other drivers, which means removing the
special no-async ability and having it use the standard get
a future and wait on it to return (and repeat).

Change-Id: I14d227a0e6a80da80eb2580b1780ae1dba128b21
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove file-driver special no-async abilities

To enable a following commit to unify the `run_watchers` of
the various drivers we need to make the file driver method
look more like the other drivers, which means removing the
special no-async ability and having it use the standard get
a future and wait on it to return (and repeat).

Change-Id: I14d227a0e6a80da80eb2580b1780ae1dba128b21

v2.0 and v3 APIs.

commit_message:
neutron: remove deprecated allow_duplicate_networks config option

Commit 4306d9190f49e7fadf88669d18effedabc880d3b deprecated the
allow_duplicate_networks config option in Kilo and marked it for removal
in Liberty where the default behavior is to just allow duplicate
networks.

This simply removes the option and checks/tests around it being False.

DocImpact: Removed neutron.allow_duplicate_networks config option. The
           behavior in Liberty is now to simply allow duplicate
           networks.

Change-Id: Icb3510bcf0c30e11d0304a86ead91a43f37602ec

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-18 10:56:38.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py'], 'message': 'logging failed exception info for add image operation

Add image operation failed will lead to rollback operation,
delete this image if it was created.
If this operation throws some exception, previous one will be
overwritten so that we cannot elegantly trace the problem occurs.
We could log failed exception info before rollback operation.

Change-Id: Ie2efcedbd647adb827f40c2ef6673c615046c6a4
modified:   glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
logging failed exception info for add image operation

Add image operation failed will lead to rollback operation,
delete this image if it was created.
If this operation throws some exception, previous one will be
overwritten so that we cannot elegantly trace the problem occurs.
We could log failed exception info before rollback operation.

Change-Id: Ie2efcedbd647adb827f40c2ef6673c615046c6a4
modified:   glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py

commit_message:
Make the 3PAR drivers honor the pool in create

Updated 3PAR's usage of the extra spec setting hp3par:cpg. This
setting is ignored in Kilo; the hp3par_cpg setting in cinder.conf
should be used instead.
Closes-Bug: 1434292

Change-Id: Idac6b7b2aaa04e06bc9066a38d52683da70395ee

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I7344c794b73aca1e0dcad681a4c43e3a66dd2eb3

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Iaf9247f90ba26615d02e5431d6bc98f22351caa7

commit_message:
Allow ``OS_DEBUG`` environment variable to specify log level.

Preserve original behavior when ``OS_DEBUG`` is ``True``, but if variable
is set to a valid log level, such as 'WARNING' use that level instead to
allow finer grained control over verbosity of log messages with the
FakeLogger.

Change-Id: I6594cec8de6fa221fe81f663a9126b2df8762ef3
Closes-Bug: 1280454

commit_message:
Get rid of oslo-incubator copy of middleware

We have already moved all projects away from openstack/common/middleware
modules to the oslo_middlware library. We don't need these files here
anymore.

Change-Id: I1b4cfa4a8a318d83ac107f3f631c9f1fd24178f9

subject: Revert "timeutils: deprecate isotime()"
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-09 01:23:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Revert "timeutils: deprecate isotime()"

This reverts commit 5cad113739fa906c3901e530fcbfdee3b48961c1.

The deprecation message says to use datetime.datetime.isoformat()
instead, but the format of the string generated by isoformat isn't
the same as the format of the string generated by isotime. The string
is used in tokens generated by keystone and other public APIs so the
format generated by isotime must continue to be used otherwise we'd
be violating the OpenStack API stability guideline. The function is
used in both keystone and keystoneclient, so if this isn't in a
common place like oslo.utils then we need to copy-paste the code
into multiple projects.

Change-Id: Iaa732bdf8597835f2422b3e984c35397e3637e01
Closes-Bug: 1461251

commit_message:
Revert "timeutils: deprecate isotime()"

This reverts commit 5cad113739fa906c3901e530fcbfdee3b48961c1.

The deprecation message says to use datetime.datetime.isoformat()
instead, but the format of the string generated by isoformat isn't
the same as the format of the string generated by isotime. The string
is used in tokens generated by keystone and other public APIs so the
format generated by isotime must continue to be used otherwise we'd
be violating the OpenStack API stability guideline. The function is
used in both keystone and keystoneclient, so if this isn't in a
common place like oslo.utils then we need to copy-paste the code
into multiple projects.

Change-Id: Iaa732bdf8597835f2422b3e984c35397e3637e01
Closes-Bug: 1461251

commit_message:
Move files into the right spot and get tests working

* Move files from keystone folder into appropriate folders
* Move tests from keystone into appropriate folders
* Fix imports to use the new module locations
* Add a _i18n.py to help with localication
* Add a BaseTestcase class
* Add a exceptions module

All just enough to run the tests. Though some tests were commented
with a FIXME to be fixed in later commits.

A few additional tests were not working with py34 and they are
skipped using testtools.skipIf statements.

Change-Id: Ib494d2a960cab5959c2adaca1eb0739fe65d14f1

commit_message:
Don't sanitize node names for log directories

The naming of nodes has recently changed so this is no longer needed. We
used to do it to strip out the random part of node names in order to
assist searching.

Change-Id: If9bdeb898016e67e873566c8bde12c8bf2d08b70

commit_message:
Python 3: do not use cmp(), nor sorted(..., cmp=...)

* The "cmp" function has been removed, so we must not use it any more;
* The "cmp" keyword argument of the "sorted" function has been removed, so
  replace it with "key=functool.cmp_to_key".

Change-Id: Ic39d29dc1002a68f36f04c32e53a36bc826dce78
Blueprint: neutron-python3

commit_message:
Remove usage of WritableLogger from oslo_log

With Eventlet 0.17.2, we can directly pass the logger
instance. This allows us to deprecate/remove the WritableLogger
class from oslo.log.

Closes-Bug: #1440773
Change-Id: I3985b30b499a1e676d39c2a6cd3a31ac13c0ab47

commit_message:
Adopt oslo guru meditation report to Keystone

This spec proposes adoption for Oslo Guru Meditation reports in Keystone.
The new feature will enhance debugging capabilities of all official
Keystone services, by providing an easy way to gather runtime data about
current threads and configuration, among other things, to developers,
operators, and tech support.

blueprint guru-meditation-report

Change-Id: I40461f01039c2a1fa8e7f61f531f07bd23769d03

commit_message:
Enable Orchestration in DevStack

Heat is configured by default on DevStack for
Icehouse and Juno releases. Newer versions of
OpenStack require enabling Heat services in
DevStack local.conf.

Change-Id: I236178edab04999852d41590aeb2210a23c1a66f

subject: Wrong config file is used for the M2 plug-in
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-07 09:20:53.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-network-node.xml'], 'message': "Wrong config file is used for the M2 plug-in

The install-guide advises to edit the [ovs] section inside the
 /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini file. However, this file
 doesn't contain any [ovs] section. Instead, the install-guide
 should advise to use
 /etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini,
 which contains the section, and which should be used for
 editing the [ovs] section.

Change-Id: I7c410752b41e3f5e423bdde1f0546309f34e84a8
Closes-Bug: #1422038
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Wrong config file is used for the M2 plug-in

The install-guide advises to edit the [ovs] section inside the
 /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini file. However, this file
 doesn't contain any [ovs] section. Instead, the install-guide
 should advise to use
 /etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini,
 which contains the section, and which should be used for
 editing the [ovs] section.

Change-Id: I7c410752b41e3f5e423bdde1f0546309f34e84a8
Closes-Bug: #1422038

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-07 09:08:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add dnsmasq_dns_servers = <some-dns-server> as a parameter in dhcp_agent.ini

Current /etc/neutron/dhcp_agent.ini in the installation guide doesn't
specify the dns-servers to be included in its configuration.

Due to this, DNS will not work in the demo-instance created in Chapter 14
because dnsmasq will not know how to handle the request in the demo-net.
ping -c openstack.org will fail without the proper forwader.

Correcting this by adding comma-separated list of DNS servers which will
be used by dnsmasq as forwarders.

Closes-Bug : #1439369

Change-Id: I9932f1c7e731a142bd097e3f35293777a397b9b3
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-08 10:42:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Missing DNS forwarder config in subnet creation

DNS will not work in the demo-instance created in Chapter 14 because
dnsmasq will not know how to handle the request in the demo-net.
ping -c openstack.org will fail without the proper forwader.

Correcting this by adding '--dns-nameservers list=true 8.8.8.8 8.8.4.4'
to the demo subnet creation.

Closes-Bug: #1439369

Change-Id: I9932f1c7e731a142bd097e3f35293777a397b9b3

commit_message:
Missing DNS forwarder config in subnet creation

DNS will not work in the demo-instance created in Chapter 14 because
dnsmasq will not know how to handle the request in the demo-net.
ping -c openstack.org will fail without the proper forwader.

Correcting this by adding '--dns-nameservers list=true 8.8.8.8 8.8.4.4'
to the demo subnet creation.

backport: juno icehouse
Closes-Bug: #1439369

Change-Id: I9932f1c7e731a142bd097e3f35293777a397b9b3

subject: Fixes parameter order for neutron subnet-create
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-29 11:56:03.000000000', 'files': ['doc/networking-guide/source/deploy_scenario1b.rst'], 'message': 'Fixes parameter order for neutron subnet-create

The order for the parameters of neturon subnet-create
is incorrect. The name of the network to which this
subnet belongs to must be placed before the CIDR.
This change fixes the placement.

Change-Id: I381e5bf66e11a6fea400737d351798033d946ae9
Closes-Bug: #1460029
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes parameter order for neutron subnet-create

The order for the parameters of neturon subnet-create
is incorrect. The name of the network to which this
subnet belongs to must be placed before the CIDR.
This change fixes the placement.

Change-Id: I381e5bf66e11a6fea400737d351798033d946ae9
Closes-Bug: #1460029

subject: Uncap pytz
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-13 21:32:19.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Uncap pytz

pytz is a pretty small project without any dependencies of it's own so
it's not a transitive dependency creep risk, and Babel requires it
uncapped, so capping it in g-r is probably not a safe idea given pycadf
is using it and now has a stable/icehouse branch.

So let's uncap pytz and avoid a future gate wedge in stable/icehouse.

Change-Id: I3ca651a4377d61be3fed572355326bc180ad7eec
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Uncap pytz

pytz is a pretty small project without any dependencies of it's own so
it's not a transitive dependency creep risk, and Babel requires it
uncapped, so capping it in g-r is probably not a safe idea given pycadf
is using it and now has a stable/icehouse branch.

So let's uncap pytz and avoid a future gate wedge in stable/icehouse.

Change-Id: I3ca651a4377d61be3fed572355326bc180ad7eec

default_reseller_prefix, any domain which matches in this middleware,
will will be passed on with a reseller prefix, whether or not it was

Change-Id: I5aa5ce78ad1ee2e3660cce4c3e07306f8999f02a
Implements: blueprint domainremap-reseller-domains

commit_message:
Allow default reseller prefix in domain_remap middleware

Previously, the reseller prefix needed to be provided in the host name
even when the domain was unique to that reseller. With the
default_reseller_prefix, any domain which matches in this middleware,
will will be passed on with a reseller prefix, whether or not it was
provided.

Change-Id: I5aa5ce78ad1ee2e3660cce4c3e07306f8999f02a
Implements: blueprint domainremap-reseller-domains
