', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-06-04 13:41:48.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_service.py', 'openstack/common/service.py'], 'message': "Graceful shutdown WSGI server

Currently, termination of WSGI application immediately stops service and so
interrupts in-progress request. This could cause problem when do upgrading.

Following related things were done:
1. Removed signal handler for SIGINT to allow instantaneous shutdown.
2. Call launcher.stop() was moved from _child_wait_for_exit_or_signal method
to SIGTERM signal handler and pipe_watcher method because service must not be
stopped for example if SIGHUP comes.
3. Added stop server operation before sending TERM signal to children
processes to close listening socket in master process. Because if socket in
master process is opened, user could successfully connects to API server but
without receiving response.
4. On children side before calling _exit() added call launcher.wait() to allow
gracefully shutdown on SIGTERM.
5. Removed service.wait() from Services.stop() to make it not-blocking call.
6. Removed stop-start operations from Services.restart method because of two
reasons:
  - why stop/start service if we have reset() service's method;
  - to allow graceful shutdown implementation of service.stop() must contain
    closing listening server socket. And there is no possibility to open new
    socket and bind it with current address/port in service.start method if it
    was closed.

DocImpact: graceful termination of process can be done by sending SIGTERM
signal to parent WSGI process. Graceful termination is not instantaneous.
To force instantaneous termination SIGINT signal must be sent.

Change-Id: If25f9565d832d1c36642ec3b1921563ef02890aa
Closes-bug: #1382390
Co-Author: Tiantian Gao <gtt116@gmail.com>
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Graceful shutdown WSGI server

Currently, termination of WSGI application immediately stops service and so
interrupts in-progress request. This could cause problem when do upgrading.

Following related things were done:
1. Removed signal handler for SIGINT to allow instantaneous shutdown.
2. Call launcher.stop() was moved from _child_wait_for_exit_or_signal method
to SIGTERM signal handler and pipe_watcher method because service must not be
stopped for example if SIGHUP comes.
3. Added stop server operation before sending TERM signal to children
processes to close listening socket in master process. Because if socket in
master process is opened, user could successfully connects to API server but
without receiving response.
4. On children side before calling _exit() added call launcher.wait() to allow
gracefully shutdown on SIGTERM.
5. Removed service.wait() from Services.stop() to make it not-blocking call.
6. Removed stop-start operations from Services.restart method because of two
reasons:
  - why stop/start service if we have reset() service's method;
  - to allow graceful shutdown implementation of service.stop() must contain
    closing listening server socket. And there is no possibility to open new
    socket and bind it with current address/port in service.start method if it
    was closed.

DocImpact: graceful termination of process can be done by sending SIGTERM
signal to parent WSGI process. Graceful termination is not instantaneous.
To force instantaneous termination SIGINT signal must be sent.

Change-Id: If25f9565d832d1c36642ec3b1921563ef02890aa
Closes-bug: #1382390
Co-Author: Tiantian Gao <gtt116@gmail.com>

Update version for Liberty

Update the version for Liberty, switching from date-based versioning
to pre-versioning using SemVer. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/065211.html
and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067082.html
for details.

commit_message:
Graceful shutdown of RPC server

Currently, killing a RPC server will immediately stop service which
interrupts in-process request.
This patch gracefuly handle shutdown.

This patch should not be merged. It is just a proof of concept for review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/190175/

Change-Id: I12dafb35850045a0b01b0be3a8b7c85508b540ae

subject: Database changes for conductor horizontal scale
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-09 04:41:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Support multiple conductors for scaling

Since conductors will be more than one, we need to lock the bay
that performs an atomic operation. Requests will be deliver to
conductors in a round-robin way. If a conductor locked a bay and crashes,
another conductor will try to steal the locks to move forward.

Change-Id: I95f28361eea361d878d2c047937c3beef4fb445a
Implements: blueprint horizontal-scale
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-10 23:38:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Database changes for horizontal-scale support

Add database APIs for a conductor to lock or release a bay.
In addition, add an API for a conductor to steal the
lock of a bay that was locked by another conductor.

Change-Id: I95f28361eea361d878d2c047937c3beef4fb445a
Partial-Implements: blueprint horizontal-scale
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-04-11 16:09:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Database changes for conductor horizontal scale

Add database APIs for a conductor to lock/steal/release a bay.
There will be more than one conductors, so it is necessary to
implement a distributed locking APIs to prevent race condictions.

* Lock acquisition: A conductor should acquire a lock when it is
  about to perform an operation on a bay (e.g. create/update/delete
  a bay). The conductor should check the return value of the APIs
  to determine if the lock is successfully acquired. If yes, another
  conductor that attempts to lock the same bay will not succeed.
  Upon completion, the conductor should release the acquired lock to
  allow other conductors to operate the bay later.
* Lock stealing: If conductor A acquires a lock and crashes
  unexpectedly, conductor B can steal the lock acquired by
  conductor A. To do that, conductor B needs to give the id of
  conductor A along with other parameters. The lock stealing will
  succeed if the bay is indeed locked by conductor A at the moment
  of the stealing requests.

Change-Id: I95f28361eea361d878d2c047937c3beef4fb445a
Partial-Implements: blueprint horizontal-scale
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-04-11 16:27:22.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'magnum/db/api.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/db/test_baylock.py', 'magnum/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'magnum/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/456126c6c9e9_create_baylock_table.py'], 'message': 'Database changes for conductor horizontal scale

commit_message:
Database changes for conductor horizontal scale

Add database APIs for a conductor to lock/steal/release a bay.
There will be more than one conductors, so it is necessary to
implement a distributed locking APIs to prevent race conditions.

* Lock acquisition: A conductor should acquire a lock when it is
  about to perform an operation on a bay (e.g. create/update/delete
  a bay). The conductor should check the return value of the APIs
  to determine if the lock is successfully acquired. If yes, another
  conductor that attempts to lock the same bay will not succeed.
  Upon completion, the conductor should release the acquired lock to
  allow other conductors to operate the bay later.
* Lock stealing: If conductor A acquires a lock and crashes
  unexpectedly, conductor B can steal the lock acquired by
  conductor A. To do that, conductor B needs to give the id of
  conductor A along with other parameters. The lock stealing will
  succeed if the bay is indeed locked by conductor A at the moment
  of the stealing requests.

Change-Id: I95f28361eea361d878d2c047937c3beef4fb445a
Partial-Implements: blueprint horizontal-scale

Iptables doesn't properly block the broadcast traffic crossing

commit_message:
Use ebtables to isolate dhcp traffic

Iptables doesn't properly block the broadcast traffic crossing
the bridge, so use ebtables instead. Removes test which is no
longer valid since we are not using iptables anymore.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/network/test_linux_net.py

Change-Id: I43e5f1fe9512dd3ec9595c7203bc46837cef3cad
Closes-Bug: #1318104
(cherry picked from commit 1236b09076cca3b4b16538b055e52edde5a4feea)

commit_message:
Rework nova_v2 driver

Some erroneous implementations were included into nova_v2 driver
when switching sdk interface from resource call to function call.
This patch fixed these errors to make nova_v2 driver work.

Change-Id: Idabdf2c062d52ff6a0627328fa10d6255cf9bcaa

commit_message:
Delay interpolating the LOG string

If the log level isn't even enabled, we can avoid interpolating
the formatted string completly, so choose to do that by default.

Change-Id: Ibf2253b859a9196a0f4cebd78b565fedf5199832

commit_message:
Add missing backups entry to default quota class

Default quota class stores default setting for quota, however,
backup quota is missing into the database. As result deprecated
message caused: "Deprecated: Default quota for resource:<resource>
is set by the default quota flag: <quota flag>, it is now
deprecated. Please use the default quota class for default quota."

This commit add default entry for quota at migration time if there
is not already in 'default' quota class.

Change-Id: Iba9af1ec1aee72841682c6ea1a9cfe6d2a2078ef
Partial-Bug: #1435807

Allow customization of dhcp_domain setting from agents/dhcp.pp

customizable from the agents/dhcp class.

commit_message:
Add Neutron Loadbalancer v1 create and update pools

Enable benchmarking of the Neutron LoadBalancer v1
lb-pool-create and lb-pool-update APIs. Due to the
different API scheme and confusing naming conventions
in Neutron (LB is v1 API and LBaaS for v2 API) the
appropriate code is explicitly marked with 'v1'
since this only implements the API v1 benchmarking.

Change-Id: I15c9c8878391ba30ec7da6fa91231e8fed1d23cf

commit_message:
Set max volume size limit for the tenant

There is a need to limit maximum size of a volume to levels
that the storage infrastructure can handle.
Setting a maximum limit on size of a volume also prevents
a tenant from creating large volumes that have not been tested
and certified to satisfy SLA objectives.

This feature allows admin to set volume size limit
[per_volume_gigabytes] for a tenant.

Change-Id: I407f09f442934220394466a8aca9331534fb6df5
Implements: blueprint cinder-quota-define-per-volume

subject: Devstack to support an IPv6 infra installation
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-23 16:22:09.000000000', 'files': ['lib/databases/mysql', 'lib/cinder', 'lib/nova', 'lib/keystone', 'lib/glance', 'lib/neutron_plugins/ml2', 'lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': 'Devstack to support an IPv6 infra installation

Currently devstack provides the necessary support to have an IPv4 based
OpenStack infrastructure where the services are binded to IPv4 addresses.
However, it does not support an IPv6 infra installation where OpenStack
services are binded to IPv6 addresses.

While testing such a setup, it is observed that some of the parameters
are not configurable/set by devstack. Because of this, the respective
openstack components would use the default values for some parameters
(which generally fall-back to using the IPv4 address of the host).

This patch would help us in configuring the required parameters, to achieve
an IPv6 based OpenStack setup.

Closes-Bug: #1447692
Change-Id: If13e60ee879395e07f26c0094b1b4c0dd481bd51
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Devstack to support an IPv6 infra installation

Currently devstack provides the necessary support to have an IPv4 based
OpenStack infrastructure where the services are binded to IPv4 addresses.
However, it does not support an IPv6 infra installation where OpenStack
services are binded to IPv6 addresses.

While testing such a setup, it is observed that some of the parameters
are not configurable/set by devstack. Because of this, the respective
openstack components would use the default values for some parameters
(which generally fall-back to using the IPv4 address of the host).

This patch would help us in configuring the required parameters, to achieve
an IPv6 based OpenStack setup.

Closes-Bug: #1447692
Change-Id: If13e60ee879395e07f26c0094b1b4c0dd481bd51

AutoScalingCeilometer.yaml
can have update error when execute on some resources

logic in _needs_update method to avoid this error occur(nested()

commit_message:
Stack updated error if creation fails

template https://github.com/openstack/heat-templates/blob/
67301b6ff45b9f1c220ee0a0ab3aecd3a415032b/cfn/F17/
AutoScalingCeilometer.yaml
can have update error when execute on some resources
which did not even created due to creation failed.

Add check logic in _needs_update to make sure even resource still
stay in init complete state can proceed update process by
raise resource.UpdateReplace.

For nested stack, StackResource should have the same status check
logic in _needs_update method to avoid this error occur(nested()
is None due to resource in failed state after create failed).

Change-Id: I3fa6a61436e79409fe7f28cf66dfdfd9f609b576
Closes-Bug: #1459719

Add list_repos_by_tag.py

Add a script to print a list of repositories with specific tags.

commit_message:
use announce list instead of dev list

Change the default email_to address to the openstack-announce mailing
list instead of openstack-dev.

Add an --email-reply-to option to control where replies should go, and
set the default to the openstack-dev mailing list.

Change-Id: Ia22d0f2a01c6c55a72ddc0f8eb97cbb501c8af70

commit_message:
let the caller specify the project owner

If the repository hasn't been added to the governance repo yet, the tool
to figure out which project tag to add will fail. Let the user specify
the value as an environment variable.

Change-Id: Ibc06c330c3a179fd5b128ce6952fae577729d7d9
